page.title: 01WELCOME TO SPEKE.....
page.content: Speke has come a long way since it was first mentioned in the original Domesday Book in 1086. There it was written that Speke was held by Uctred, and had been since 1066. In those long-off days it was known as the manor of Speke. It was part of the forestership of Lancashire. Today Speke is in Merseyside. It consists largely of industrial and housing estates surrounded by the civil airfield to the west and south, industrial develpments to the north, and the rural aspect of Hale to the east. In stark contrast to the brick-built council houses and factories, it can boast of a great heritage in the beautiful, half-timbered Speke Hall which has graced the area since the fifteenth century. Written by Mrs.Shinkfield and 4S.
